segment.source: Confirm That Certificates Are Deployed Correctly (Windows 10)
segment.target: Confirm That Certificates Are Deployed Correctly (Windows 10)

segment.source: Confirm That Certificates Are Deployed Correctly
segment.target: Confirm That Certificates Are Deployed Correctly

segment.source: Confirm That Certificates Are Deployed Correctly
segment.target: Confirm That Certificates Are Deployed Correctly

segment.source: Applies to
segment.target: Applies to

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview
segment.target: Windows Server 2016 Technical Preview

segment.source: After configuring your certificates and autoenrollment in Group Policy, you can confirm that the policy is being applied as expected, and that the certificates are being properly installed on the workstation devices.
segment.target: After configuring your certificates and autoenrollment in Group Policy, you can confirm that the policy is being applied as expected, and that the certificates are being properly installed on the workstation devices.

segment.source: In these procedures, you refresh Group Policy on a client device, and then confirm that the certificate is deployed correctly.
segment.target: In these procedures, you refresh Group Policy on a client device, and then confirm that the certificate is deployed correctly.

segment.source: Administrative credentials
segment.target: Administrative credentials

segment.source: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.
segment.target: To complete these procedures, you must be a member of the Domain Administrators group, or otherwise be delegated permissions to modify the GPOs.

segment.source: In this topic:
segment.target: In this topic:

segment.source: Refresh Group Policy on a device
segment.target: Refresh Group Policy on a device

segment.source: Verify that a certificate is installed
segment.target: Verify that a certificate is installed

segment.source: To refresh Group Policy on a device
segment.target: To refresh Group Policy on a device

segment.source: From an elevated command prompt, run the following command:
segment.target: From an elevated command prompt, run the following command:

segment.source: After Group Policy is refreshed, you can see which GPOs are currently applied to the device.
segment.target: After Group Policy is refreshed, you can see which GPOs are currently applied to the device.

segment.source: To verify that a certificate is installed
segment.target: To verify that a certificate is installed

segment.source: Open the Cerificates console.
segment.target: Open the Cerificates console.

segment.source: In the navigation pane, expand Trusted Root Certification Authorities, and then click Certificates.
segment.target: In the navigation pane, expand Trusted Root Certification Authorities, and then click Certificates.

segment.source: The CA that you created appears in the list.
segment.target: The CA that you created appears in the list.
